## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}

#install.packages("haven")
# install.packages("tidyverse")
# install.packages("dplyr")
# install.packages("psych")
# install.packages("DT")
library(haven)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(psych)
library(knitr)
library(DT)
MPAC_survey_data <- read_sav("C:/Users/smangane/Downloads/MPAC_survey_data.sav")
include_graphics("SPSS_variableview.png")

MPAC_survey_labels <- c() # a text vector

for (i in 1: ncol(MPAC_survey_data)) {
  MPAC_survey_labels[i] <- attr(MPAC_survey_data[[i]],"label")
} # double brackets to query variable labels

`%!in%` <- Negate(`%in%`)

DV_col1 <- which(grepl("GUN_", names(MPAC_survey_data))) # GUN law related columns (step 1)

DV_col1 <- DV_col1[!DV_col1 %in% which(grepl("_REC", names(MPAC_survey_data)))] # removed recoded binary variables (step 2)

MPAC_survey_labels[DV_col1]

#https://rpubs.com/tiangenglu/import_SPSS_variable_view - use this to import variable view
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
